Description: The NT Kernel (ntoskrnl.exe). Handles hardware abstraction, drivers, and kernel threads.
Session Manager. Sets up environment variables, handles virtual memory, and starts csrss/winlogon.
Suspicious Sign: Parent!=System(4); More than 1 instance running persistently; User!=SYSTEM

Description: Client/Server Runtime Subsystem. Critical user-mode subsystem. Manages console windows, shutdown, and threads.
Legal Parent(s): Created by smss.exe (Logs); Parent appears 'Non-existent' (Live Triage)
Suspicious Sign: Has an ACTIVE parent process; Path!=System32; User!=SYSTEM

Description: Windows Initialization. Launches services.exe, lsass.exe, and lsaiso.exe in Session 0.
Legal Parent(s): Created by smss.exe (Logs); Parent appears 'Non-existent' (Live Triage)
Suspicious Sign: Has an ACTIVE parent process; Multiple instances; User!=SYSTEM

Description: Service Control Manager (SCM). Manages services, drivers, and updates 'LastKnownGood' config. Parent to svchost, spoolsv, msmpeng, dllhost.
Host Process for Windows Services. Loads DLLs specified in Registry (Parameters\ServiceDLL). Uses '-k' to group services.
Instances: Multiple (Many, Win10+ separates services if RAM > 3.5GB)

Description: Local Security Authority. Enforces security policies, handles logins/tokens. #1 Target for Credential Dumping (Mimikatz).
Suspicious Sign: Parent!=wininit.exe; Multiple instances; User!=SYSTEM; Path!=System32; Misspelled (e.g. Isass.exe)

Description: Windows Logon. Handles SAS (Ctrl+Alt+Del), loads user profile. Guardians of the 'Shell' registry key.
Legal Parent(s): Created by smss.exe (Logs); Parent appears 'Non-existent' (Live Triage)
Suspicious Sign: Has ACTIVE parent; User!=SYSTEM; Spawns cmd/powershell; Modified 'Userinit' Registry"

Description: User Initialization. Executes logon scripts and starts explorer.exe.
Suspicious Sign: Persistent existence (should terminate); Parent != winlogon.exe; Unexpected path.

Description: User Shell. Provides the GUI (Desktop, Taskbar). Spawns all user applications (Browser, Office, CMD).
Legal Parent(s): Created by userinit.exe (Logs); Parent appears 'Non-existent' (Live Triage)
Suspicious Sign: Parent is ACTIVE process; User=SYSTEM; Outbound C2 Beaconing; Spawning svchost.exe

Description: Windows Logon User Interface. Provides the graphical UI for logging on.
Suspicious Sign: Parent != winlogon.exe; Spawning unexpected child processes.

Description: Print Spooler. Manages print jobs and interaction with printers.
Host Process for Windows Tasks. Hosts scheduled tasks implemented as DLLs.
Windows Defender Antimalware Service. The core AV engine protecting the system.
Suspicious Sign: Parent!=services.exe; Location not in Program Files; Stopping/Killing attempts

Description: COM Surrogate. Hosts COM objects outside the original process (e.g. for stability).
Suspicious Sign: Parent is Office/Browser (Phishing); Loading unsigned DLLs; Network Connections (C2)

Description: WMI Provider Host. Used by apps to access system management info.
Suspicious Sign: Parent != svchost.exe; Non-standard path; Spawns cmd/powershell for WMI consumers.

Description: Host process for WinRM and PowerShell Remoting sessions. (e.g. Enter-PSSession)
Suspicious Sign: Spawning reconnaissance tools (whoami; net user); Parent is NOT svchost.exe; Unexpected network connections.

Description: Windows Search Indexer. Indexing service for Windows search features.
Suspicious Sign: Parent != services.exe; Multiple instances; Unexpected path (e.g. \Temp).

Description: Windows Task Manager. Displays current CPU/Memory usage and processes.
Suspicious Sign: Parent != explorer.exe (or shell); Image path != System32; User == SYSTEM.
